thread.title: Motorcyclist taken to hospital following crash in Stockport
thread.title_full: Motorcyclist taken to hospital following crash in Stockport

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Motorcyclist taken to hospital following crash in Stockport
text:
News Motorcyclist taken to hospital following crash in Stockport Paramedics, the air ambulance and police were called to the scene of the collision on Gilmore Street, Shaw Heath Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Air Ambulance lands on Shaw Heath park Share this video Get daily   Could   
A motorcyclist has been taken to hospital following a collision with a car in Stockport. 
Paramedics, the air ambulance and police were called to the scene of the collision on Gilmore Street, Shaw Heath. 
The collision, involving a black Audi, is understood to have took place shortly after 12.05pm on Wednesday afternoon. 
Images shared on social media show the air ambulance landing at nearby Kimberley Street Park. 
The motorcyclist has been taken to Wythenshawe Hospital in an ambulance. 
The extent of his injuries are not known at this stage. Read More Dangerous armed robber who escaped prison by climbing over a wall is back behind bars 
A spokesman for the ambulance service said: “We were called at 12.05pm to reports of a road traffic collision involving a car and a motorbike. 
“We arrived at the scene at 12.11pm. We sent a rapid response vehicle, a land ambulance and air ambulance. 
“We are on our way to taking the patient to Wythenshawe Hospital by land ambulance.” 
A Greater Manchester Police spokesman said: “We were called shortly before 12.10pm to a collision involving a motorbike and a car. 
“The heli-med and paramedics are at the scene. 
“The car involved was a black Audi A4.” Like us on Facebook
